name: InitialDayOfObservationEncounterForHighSeverityProblem
title: Initial Day of Observation Encounter for High Severity Problem
description: This value set includes CPT codes for initial day of  observation care for a high severity problem
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values contains CPT codes for initial day of  observation care for a high severity problem),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients admitted to hospital observation care for a high severity problem. This element may map to the "Encounter" Category of the Quality Data Model.),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes hospital encounters for which a patient is admitted to observation care for a problem of high severity.),(Exclusion Criteria: Excludes encounters for for which a patient is admitted to observation care for a problem of low or moderate severity. Excludes encounters for discharge day observation care when the discharge is on a day other than initial day of observation care.)

concept.display: Initial observation care, per day, for the evaluation and management of a patient, which requires these 3 key components: A comprehensive history; A comprehensive examination; and Medical decision making of high complexity. Counseling and/or coordination of care with other physicians, other qualified health care professionals, or agencies are provided consistent with the nature of the problem(s) and the patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the problem(s) requiring admission to outpatient hospital "observation status" are of high severity. Typically, 70 minutes are spent at the bedside and on the patient's hospital floor or unit.
